title: Pink, pink and distinctly pink Font ID
content:
Please help me identify the 3 fonts used for these logos.  
-Pink  
-pink  
-distinctly pink designs

Thanks.

[Pink Logos](http://web.archive.org/web/20090502113540/http:/typophile.com/files/Pink.JPG)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Pink.JPG](http://web.archive.org/web/20090502113540/http:/typophile.com/files/Pink.JPG) | 13.42 KB |
author: xsalt

comments.content: The first in the JPG is [French Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20090502113540/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/french_script_std_regular/&sample_text=pink&sample_size=60). See more of this ilk in this [Upright Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20090502113540/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/genres/upright_script/) list.

Cool... perfect match!  
Thank you so much Mr. Coles.

Two more to go!

Anyone up for the challenge?

The “distinctly” is set in some [Didone](http://web.archive.org/web/20090502113540/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/subclasses/serif_didone/&sample_text=distinctly%20pink%20designs), but it’s too small to be sure which one.

The second Pink is freefont [Glider Girls](http://web.archive.org/web/20090502113540/http:/www.abstractfonts.com/font/10985) found by [Koeiekat](http://web.archive.org/web/20090502113540/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=193014).
